result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel R. Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Eau Claire County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 
2 days sentence credit if revoked from probation.
Concurrent with: with 21CF1332 and 22CF449

miscConds.notes: PAYABLE DIRECTLY TO AND COLLECTED BY EAU CLAIRE COUNTY CLERK OF COURT.  NOT A CONDITION OF PROBATION.
Undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Comply with any conditions/programming per agent.

No contact with T.S. 
No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel R. Peterson

records.addlTxt: Time to Pay Summary mailed to Defendant
(See Plea Hearing docket event for details of waiver)

(Cases called at 4:02 PM - 21CF1332, 22CF449, and 22CF622)
Defendant Daniel Peterson appears in custody with Attorney Robert Thorson.  Attorney Andrew Gunderson appears for the State of Wisconsin.
State outlines the agreement for the Court.  Defense takes time, off record, to complete paperwork as the offer change slightly.  Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing in all files - waiver accepted by Court.  Defendant acknowledges the Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form.  Defendant advised of the elements of the charges to which he will plead, as well as the maximum possible penalties.  Defendant acknowledges basis for Repeater enhancer.  Defendant pleads No Contest to 21CF1332 Count 1: Vehicle Operator - Flee/Elude Officer (Repeater); 22CF449 Count 1: Take and Drive Motor Vehicle Without Owner's Consent; 22CF622 Count 1: Vehicle Operator - Flee/Elude Officer (Repeater).  Defendant advised of his Constitutional rights.  Court accepts pleas and finds Defendant guilty of the charges to which he has pled.  Remaining charges are dismissed and read in.  Defense makes comments regarding the agreement.  

Court withholds sentence and orders 4 years of probation with the following conditions: 60 days in jail, with Huber (on 21CF1332) stayed pending further order of the Court.  No contact with T.S.  Undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting.  Comply with any conditions/programming per agent.  Provide DNA sample and pay fee.  Pay court costs.  In the event of revocation, 6 days credit in 21CF1332, 2 days credit in 22CF449 and 22CF622.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
(Case called at 11:13 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Daniel Peterson appears in custody via video conference from the Jail with Attorney Katherine Cook. ADA Kelly Ronquist appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense waives reading of the complaint. Defendant is eligible for Public Defender representation. Time limits for preliminary hearing are waived. 
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 06/29/2022 at 1:15 PM. 
Hearing: 07/11/2022 at 4:00 PM (Branch 5).
